name: Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer
desc:
"Whirling Memories" Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer

"The children of the desert have a rich tradition of song and dance. Originally used to praise and serve the gods, the crafts were later adapted for battle and the seduction of kings."

desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Skill</color>
Deals 3 <color=#99ff88>Dendro DMG</color> , creates 1 stack of <color=#ffffff>Spirit-Serpent's Blessing</color> .
<color=#ece5d8>Spirit-Serpent's Blessing</color>
<color=#ffd780>Combat Status</color>
<color=#ffffff>When your Spirit of Omen: Dendro Spirit-Serpent uses Technique:</color> The DMG dealt by this <color=#ffffff>Technique</color> +1, and does not consume <color=#ffffff>Usage(s)</color> of Spirit of Omen: Dendro Spirit-Serpent.
<color=#ffffff>Usage(s)</color> : 1 (Can stack, no limit)

talent.key: Spirit of Omen's Awakening: Dendro Spirit-Serpent
talent.title: Spirit of Omen's Awakening: Dendro Spirit-Serpent

desc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Burst</color>
Deals 4 <color=#99ff88>Dendro DMG</color> . Once each Match, add 1 <color=#ffffff>Spirit of Omen: Dendro Spirit-Serpent</color> card to your Hand.
(Characters with <color=#ffffff>Spirit of Omen: Dendro Spirit-Serpent</color> equipped can use the Technique: <color=#ffffff>Viny Razorscale</color> )

<color=#ffd780>Equipment Card</color>
<color=#ffffff>Technique:</color> Viny Razorscale
<color=#ffffff>Usage(s): 2</color>
(A character can only equip 1 Technique at a time)

<color=#ffd780>Passive Skill</color>
(Passive) <color=#ffffff>After this character takes DMG:</color> If this character has no more than 7 HP, they gain 1 <color=#ffffff>Energy</color> . (Once per Round)

Applies Dendro and can trigger the following Elemental Reactions:
[ <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> + <color=#80c0ff>Hydro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Bloom</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Dendro Core</color> ] that greants +2 DMG to the next instance of Pyro or Electro DMG
[ <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> + <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Burning</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Burning Flame</color> ] that will deal 1 Pyro DMG at the end of the Round (Takes effect once, max 2 stacks)
[ <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> + <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> ] <color=#ffffff>Quicken</color> : DMG +1 for this instance, creates a [ <color=#ffffff>Catalyzing Field</color> ] that grants +1 DMG to the next 2 instances of Dendro or Electro DMG

<color=#ece5d8>Physical DMG</color>
Physical DMG will not apply any Elements, nor can it engage in Elemental Reactions.
<color=#ece5d8>Technique</color>
When the active character is equipped with a Technique card, they can use the corresponding Technique.
Using a Technique counts as a Combat Action. If the character is unable to use Skills due to conditions like Frozen, Petrification, or Stun, they are also unable to use the Technique.
Using a Technique is not considered as using a Skill. Therefore, it cannot trigger effects such as "After using a skill" or "After the character triggers an Elemental Reaction." Damage dealt by using a Technique is not considered Damage dealt by the character.
<color=#ece5d8>Usage(s)</color>
After this card's effect is triggered, 1 <color=#ffffff>Usage</color> of it will be consumed.
This card will be discarded immediately once it has 0 <color=#ffffff>Usages</color> remaining.
<color=#ece5d8>Energy</color>
Characters must consume Energy to use their Elemental Bursts.
When characters use an Elemental Skill or a Normal Attack, they will gain 1 Energy.

value.name: Spirit Serpent's Swirl
value.desc:
Floral Ring-Dancer: Spirit Serpent's Swirl

"...Even though all such gods and kings have now faded into the flowing sands, the memory of dance yet persists in the desert-dwellers' veins."

value.text: Reward for accepting the Tavern Challenge at The Cat's Tail and claiming victory in a Friendly Fracas with the Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer

value.name: Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer
value.desc:
A person hailing from the loosely-organized mercenary bands of the desert. They will work for anyone as long as the pay is good.
The children of the desert have a rich tradition of song and dance. Originally used to praise and serve the gods, the crafts were later adapted for battle and the seduction of kings. Many tales of the sands feature dancers who murdered kings relaxed in their beds or standing atop high towers. Even though all such gods and kings have now faded into the flowing sands, the memory of dance yet persists in the desert-dwellers' veins.
Ominous, fragmented spirits are sealed within the weapons they use, awakening in moments of peril. Once these weapons awaken, they can only be silenced by the cries of the vanquished — whether that be their wielders or their wielders' foes.

imgDesc.text:
<color=#ffd780>Elemental Burst</color>
Spirit of Omen's Awakening: Dendro Spirit-Serpent

<color=#ffd780>Equipment Card</color>

customize.name: Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer
customize.desc:
"Whirling Memories" Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer

"The children of the desert have a rich tradition of song and dance. Originally used to praise and serve the gods, the crafts were later adapted for battle and the seduction of kings."

customize.name: Lucky Coin
customize.desc: Currency verified and used by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Can be used to purchase various items related to Genius Invokation TCG. It is said that these coins were initially named as such in the hopes that they would bring those carrying them luck. However, perhaps it is those who are sufficiently lucky who are able to possess them...

customize.text: Can also be exchanged using a

customize.name: Blank Dynamic Card
customize.desc: A blank card with a painted back. It is said that if you put the name of your desired dynamic card on this blank card, you can get the very skin from the Association agent located at the tavern.

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Friendly Fracas - Floral Ring-Dancer's Improvisation

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow..." "My impression is that most cats don't really like snakes, especially giant weird ones that can fly..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: "Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer" starts with the Talent Card "Spirit Serpent's Swirl" equipped.</color>

customize.text: Tavern Challenge: Serious Showdown - Floral Ring-Dancer's Whirling Twirl

<color=#ffd780>Stage Introduction</color>
"Meow~" "Though, some cats from Sumeru say that they've seen mercenaries who can summon green flying snakes, and that those mercenaries are quite nice to their snakes, who in turn, aren't aggressive towards cats..."
<color=#ccbfad>Special Rule: "Eremite Floral Ring-Dancer" starts with the Talent Card "Spirit Serpent's Swirl" equipped. "Eremite Scorching Loremaster" starts with the Talent Card "Scorpocalypse" equipped.</color>
